alert.note: Alert for Ashland; Sawyer (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 7:45PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...AN AREA OF STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHWESTERN ASHLAND AND NORTHEASTERN SAWYER COUNTIES THROUGH 800 PM CDT... At 745 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstormS near Clam Lake, or 14 miles northeast of Chippewa Flowage East, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. This stormS will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Ashland and northeastern Sawyer Counties, including the following locations... Blaisdell Lake, Moose Lake Sawyer County and Ghost Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle.
